alabama: In Alabama, abortion is currently illegal. There is a complete ban except for the following exceptions: to save the pregnant person's life, to prevent serious risk to the pregnant person's physical health, or if the fetus is not expected to survive the pregnancy. You can leave Alabama and get an abortion out of state.
Alaska: In Alaska, it is legal to have an abortion. This right is protected by the state constitution.

Arizona.CurrentPolicy: In Arizona, abortion is cuurrently legal. A complete ban may no into effect, but it is NOT in place right now.
Arizona.Nuance: It is legal to have an abortion before 16 weeks, but some providers may stop offerring abortion sooner
Arizona.IfMinor: If you are a minor, you need a parent or legal guardian to give you permission. If this is not an option for you, you can seek a judicial bypass that will allow you to waive the requirement for permission. If you need help navigating this process, call the Judicial Bypass Helpline at 844-868-2812 or submit a request online HERE

Arkansas: In Arkansas, abortion is currently illegal. There is a complete ban except for the following exceptions: to save the pregnant person's life. You can leave Alabama and get an abortion out of state.
California: In California, it is legal to have an abortion.
Colerado: In Colerado, it is legal to have an abortion.
Connecticut: In Connecticut, it is legal to have an abortion.
Delaware: In Delaware, it is legal to have an abortion.

Florida.CurrentPolicy: In Florida, it is legal to have an abortion. A new law may result in more restrictions after 5/1/2024
Florida.Nuance: It is legal to have an abortion before 16 weeks, but some providers may stop offerring abortion sooner. If you are more than 16 weeks pregnant, you may still be eligible for an abortion for the following reasons: to save your life or prevent serious risk to your physical health, or if the fetus is not expected to survive the pregnancy.
Florida.IfMinor: If you are a minor, you need a parent or legal guardian to give you permission. If this is not an option for you, you can seek a judicial bypass that will allow you to waive the requirement for permission. If you need help navigating this process, call the Judicial Bypass Helpline at 844-868-2812 or submit a request online HERE

Georgia.CurrentPolicy: In Georgia, it is legal to have an abortion.
Georgia.Nuance: It is legal to have an abortion at or before around six weeks pregnant, but some providers may stop offerring abortion sooner. If you are more than 6 weeks pregnant, you may still be eligible for an abortion for the following reasons: to save your life or prevent serious risk to your physical health, if the pregnancy is a result of incest or rape, or if the fetus is not expected to survive the pregnancy.
Georgia.IfMinor: If you are a minor, you need a parent or legal guardian to give you permission. If this is not an option for you, you can seek a judicial bypass that will allow you to waive the requirement for permission. If you need help navigating this process, call the Judicial Bypass Helpline at 844-868-2812 or submit a request online HERE

You can leave North Dakota and get an abortion out of state.
